org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.nodesource.policy

Class NodeSourcePolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.nodesource.policy.NodeSourcePolicy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, NodeSourcePlugin
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CronPolicy, EmptyPolicy, InfrastructureAwarePolicy, RestartDownNodesPolicy, RMAwareNodeSourcePolicy, StaticPolicy, TimeSlotPolicy

    public abstract class NodeSourcePolicy
extends Object
implements NodeSourcePlugin
    A node source policy is a set of rules of acquiring/releasing nodes. It describes a time and conditions when and how many nodes have to be acquired from the infrastructure.

    NOTE: NodeSourcePolicy will be an active object.

    To define a new node source policy:

    • implement configure(Object...) and setup there all policy parameters which are available through UI
    • define activation and disactivation policy behavior by implementing corresponding methods
    • define how policy should react on nodes adding request initiated by user
    • add the name of new policy class to the resource manager configuration file (config/rm/nodesource/policies).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
